title: Ukraine accuses Russia of violating international law by placing Ukrainian children in Russian families.
description: The transfer of Ukrainian children from occupied territories to Russia and their adoption by Russian families is a potential war crime.

title: Amid the Slog of Mud Season, the Ukrainian Military Keeps Advancing
description: Fall rains have turned the earth to sludge, slowing advances at least until the winter freeze, in conditions that have hampered military movement for centuries.

title: Here’s how some Western powers reacted to Putin’s speech.
Saudis Find Sympathetic U.S. Ears at ‘Davos in the Desert’
description: A Saudi decision to support a cut in oil output infuriated Washington. But at an investment conference in Riyadh, there was plenty of praise for the kingdom.

title: Russia’s Defense Minister Says Draft Is Complete, and No More Are Planned
description: Announced by Mr. Putin in September, the draft sent shock waves across Russia.

title: Scarred by War, Ukraine’s Children Face Years of Trauma
description: For countless Ukrainian children, the war has brought long-term physical and psychological injuries. Those who have suffered serious physical harm or the loss of a parent now face a challenging path forward.

title: Italy’s Hard Right Feels Vindicated by Giorgia Meloni’s Ascent
description: Long marginalized politically and ostracized socially, the new prime minister’s supporters sense a chance to give a final blow to the stigma and shame of their association with Fascism.

title: With the close of his Twitter deal, Elon Musk’s geopolitical influence is set to grow.
A Beginner’s Guide to the U.S. Midterm Elections
description: What’s at stake, and how does it work? Let’s start with the basics.

title: Ksenia Sobchak, a Kremlin Critic, Leaves Russia
description: Ksenia Sobchak entered Lithuania this week.

title: Xi Jinping vs. the People
description: How Chinese citizens are responding to Xi’s lengthened rule.

title: Mud Slows Ukraine’s Advance, but Fighting Remains Intense
description: Battles are raging in the south and the east as thick sludge complicates movement for both sides.

title: Northern Ireland Likely to Hold New Election After Failing to Form a Government
description: Britain’s Northern Ireland secretary is expected to announce on Friday that a new election would be held in December after six months of fruitless efforts to convene Parliament.

title: A Government-Connected Putin Critic’s Flight From Russia Raises Questions About Who is Still Safe.
description: Ksenia Sobchak, a socialite who challenged the Russian leader at the polls but at times accommodated his agenda, entered Lithuania this week.

title: Because of Bolsonaro, Millions of Brazilians Distrust Elections
description: President Jair Bolsonaro has attacked Brazil’s electronic voting system. Now, ahead of Sunday’s elections, many of his supporters believe there will be fraud.

title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Creator Kazuki Takahashi Died Trying to Save Others
description: Kazuki Takahashi, creator of the internationally famous Yu-Gi-Oh! manga, was found dead in July. At the time, officials did not disclose the circumstances.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Here’s what you need to know.

title: For Rishi Sunak, Family Wealth From Outsourcing Adds to a Secretive Fortune
description: Britain’s new prime minister married into an $800 million stake in Infosys, a company that does not fit neatly into his party’s views on immigration.
